channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 'One year of failure.' The Lancet slams RFK Jr.'s first year as health chief
item.description: In a scathing review, the top US medical journal's editorial board warned that the "destruction that Kennedy has wrought in 1 in office might take generations to repair."
item.content:encoded:
In a scathing review, the top US medical journal's editorial board warned that the "destruction that Kennedy has wrought in 1 in office might take generations to repair."

(Image credit: Ben curtis)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Israel and the U.S. launch strikes on Iran
item.description: We're looking at the strikes in Iran by U.S. and Israel.
item.content:encoded: We're looking at the strikes in Iran by U.S. and Israel.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: As the U.S. strikes Iran, here's the White House is saying to the American public
item.description: We look at the White House's messaging to the American public on the strikes in Iran.
item.content:encoded: We look at the White House's messaging to the American public on the strikes in Iran.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Kansas revokes driver's licenses of hundreds of trans people, prompted by new law
item.description: Prompted by a new law, Kansas began sending letters to some trans people saying their drivers licenses were being invalidated until they change their gender information.
item.content:encoded: Prompted by a new law, Kansas began sending letters to some trans people saying their drivers licenses were being invalidated until they change their gender information.
item.dc:creator: Zane Irwin

item.title: A restaurant advertising free oysters for 80-year-olds and their dads found a taker
item.description: A restaurant in Mobile, AL, has a sign: "Free oysters to any man 80 years old accompanied by his father." NPR's Scott Simon talks to Jimmy Rush who showed up on his 80th birthday with his dad, Jim.
item.content:encoded: A restaurant in Mobile, AL, has a sign: "Free oysters to any man 80 years old accompanied by his father." NPR's Scott Simon talks to Jimmy Rush who showed up on his 80th birthday with his dad, Jim.
item.dc:creator: Eleana Tworek

item.title: How a new SBA policy is affecting legal immigrants' startup costs
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon asks immigrant Cristina Foanene about her experience receiving a Small Business Administration loan in light of new restrictions barring non-citizens from receiving such loans.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon asks immigrant Cristina Foanene about her experience receiving a Small Business Administration loan in light of new restrictions barring non-citizens from receiving such loans.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: North Carolina Democrats latest to chart future of the party in congressional primary
item.description: In a safe Democratic seat in North Carolina, a match-up between a two-term Congresswoman and a progressive local official show how Democrats are charting the future of their party in the age of Trump.
item.content:encoded:
In a safe Democratic seat in North Carolina, a match-up between a two-term Congresswoman and a progressive local official show how Democrats are charting the future of their party in the age of Trump.

(Image credit: Jonathan Drake/Reuters; Andrew Harnik/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Colin Campbell

item.title: Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has been killed
item.description: The Iranian government has declared 40 days of national mourning after Khamenei was killed in a U.S.–Israeli attack on Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
The Iranian government has declared 40 days of national mourning after Khamenei was killed in a U.S.–Israeli attack on Saturday.

(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Bill Clinton says he 'did nothing wrong' with Epstein as he faced grilling over their relationship
item.description: Former President Bill Clinton told members of Congress on Friday that he "did nothing wrong" in his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and saw no signs of Epstein's sexual abuse as he faced hours of grilling from lawmakers over his connections to the disgraced financier from more than two decades ago.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Bill Clinton told members of Congress on Friday that he "did nothing wrong" in his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and saw no signs of Epstein's sexual abuse as he faced hours of grilling from lawmakers over his connections to the disgraced financier from more than two decades ago.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How the federal government is painting immigrants as criminals on social media
item.description: Experts say this kind of media campaign is unprecedented and paints a distorted picture of immigrants and crime
item.content:encoded: Experts say this kind of media campaign is unprecedented and paints a distorted picture of immigrants and crime
item.dc:creator: Huo Jingnan
